name: blisteringly
content:
blisteringly adverb
(TEMPERATURE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something is blisteringly hot or cold, it is very hot or cold. : We were working on the roof during a blisteringly hot summer day. Be careful — the coffee is blisteringly hot. A blisteringly cold wind was blowing from the east.

blisteringly adverb
(SPEED)
If something is blisteringly fast, it is very fast. : The motorbike is easy to ride and blisteringly fast. The player is so blisteringly quick when he gets the ball that he seems unstoppable.

blisteringly adverb
(UNKIND)
in a way that is very unkind and shows anger, although it may also be funny: The writer's latest column is a blisteringly funny take on the mythology that surrounds professional sports. He could be blisteringly rude to fans who asked him for a photo or autograph.
